Description: Floor and foot sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery small bowl; convex ring foot with central nipple and scraped groove on resting surface; glazed black on interior, exterior (foot) and underside; reserved: junction of wall and foot, groove in resting surface; impressed decoration on interior consisting of two preserved palmettes surrounded by circle of blurred rouletting.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski compares this fragment to bowls with incurving rim (Sparkes, Agora XII nos. 830-833 figs. 8 and 22, pl, pl. 33) dated 350BC - 325BC. (See also Rotroff, Agora XXIX NO. 969 (P19360), dated around 300 BC.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.46 no. D 7 pl. 19.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.032)
